reasoning_trace.value: The paper presents a THz photonic-based ISAC system designed for fiber-wireless networks. It uses a thin-film lithium niobate Mach-Zehnder modulator (TFLN-MZM) for full-photonic direct reception and de-chirping of D-band LFM echo signals. The system achieves a range resolution of 6 mm and a peak data rate of 116 Gbit/s at a center frequency of 134 GHz.

The system's performance is evaluated in terms of sensing and communication metrics. For sensing, it achieves a calibrated mean ranging error of less than 3 mm. For communication, it achieves a peak data rate of 116 Gbit/s with a BER below 1E-2 over 20-km fiber transmission.

The paper demonstrates a novel approach to integrating sensing and communication in THz band using photonic technology. It highlights the potential for seamless integration with fiber-wireless networks and the impact of different fiber lengths on system performance.

bibliographic.value: THz Integrated Sensing and Communication With Full-Photonic Direct LFM Reception and De-Chirping for D-Band Fiber-Wireless Network
Boyu Dong, Zhongya Li, Sizhe Xing, Yinjun Liu, Junhao Zhao, Ouhan Huang, Junlian Jia, Jianyang Shi, Yingjun Zhou, Haipeng Wang, Nan Chi, Junwen Zhang
IEEE Transactions on Microwave Theory and Techniques

key_contribution.value: Full-photonic direct reception and de-chirping of THz LFM echo signals using TFLN-MZM
Direct reception and de-chirping of THz LFM signals without electronic down-conversion
TFLN-MZM with high bandwidth and low half-wave voltage
